Ph.D. Candidate
Department of Applied Mathematics
University of Washington
eang@uw.edu
Office: Lewis Hall 109
I am currently a PhD candidate in the Department of Applied Mathematics at the University of Washington in Seattle, WA. My research interests include stochastic processes, dynamical systems, and optimization with applications in cellular development and cancer biology. I am advised by Dr. Hong Qian.

Before coming to UW, I earned my B.A. in Mathematics from Pomona College in Claremont, CA, where I was advised by Dr. Blerta Shtylla.
